title: Linux® Notes for Professionals book
author: Stack Overflow Documentation
description: The Linux® Notes for Professionals book is compiled from Stack Overflow Documentation, the content is written by the beautiful people at Stack Overflow. Text content is released under Creative Commons BY-SA. See credits at the end of this book whom contributed to the various chapters. Images may be copyright of their respective owners unless otherwise specified
license: Creative Commons BY-SA. All trademarks belong to their respective company owners

title: Debian GNU/Linux: Guide to Installation and Usage
author: John Goerzen
description: Debian is a free operating system for you computer.

title: Effective AWK Programming, 3rd Edition
author: O’Reilly Media, Inc.
description: Teaches you about the awk language and how you can use it effectively. Also describes gawk, the GNU implementation of awk.

title: GTK+/Gnome Application Development
author: New Riders Publishing
description: Describes how to write a Gnome application using the Gnome libraries and tools.

title: Into the Core: A look at Tiny Core Linux
description: This book covers Core from start to finish. The concepts are explained in detail, ending up with several example projects. Build your project with complete control over what is included, what hardware is supported, with nothing extra and no bloat.

title: Introduction to Linux - A Hands on Guide
author: Fultus Corporation
description: This book covers Core from start to finish. The concepts are explained in detail, ending up with several example projects. Build your project with complete control over what is included, what hardware is supported, with nothing extra and no bloat.

title: Learning Debian GNU/Linux
author: O’Reilly Media, Inc.
description: Focuses on the needs of the new Linux user and on desktop Linux applications.

title: Linux 101 Examination Modular Training Notes
author: Leading Edge Business Solutions
description: This course material is based on the objectives for the Linux Professionals Institute's LPI 101 examination. The course is intended to provide readers with the basic skills required for operating and administering Linux systems.

title: Learning Debian GNU/Linux
author: Alessandro Rubini & Jonathan Corbet
description: Shows how to write Linux system's device drivers, for technical programmers who face the need to deal with the inner levels of a Linux box.

title: Linux Network Administrator's Guide, 2nd Edition
author: Olaf Kirch & Terry Dawson
description: Provide a single reference for beginner and experienced network administrators.

title: Secure Programming for Linux and Unix
author: David A. Wheeler
description: Provide a single reference for beginner and experienced network administrators.

title: The Debian Administrator's Handbook
author: Raphaël Hertzog and Roland Mas
description: Written by two Debian developers, this book teaches the essentials to anyone who wants to become an effective and independent Debian GNU/Linux administrator.
